Package it.polimi.ingsw.Utils

Class PlayerList

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<Player>
it.polimi.ingsw.Utils.PlayerList
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Player>, Collection<Player>, List<Player>, RandomAccess
public class PlayerList extends ArrayList<Player>
New list used for players. Adds functionality useful to manage player and their teams
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add(Player newPlayer)
      Override of the add method in ArrayList. Returns false if the player about to be added has the same nickname as some other player already inside the list, otherwise it adds the player into the list normally. Neutral players are excluded from this rule.
      Specified by:
      add in interface Collection<Player>
      Specified by:
      add in interface List<Player>
      Overrides:
      add in class ArrayList<Player>
      Parameters:
      newPlayer - the player to add
      Returns:
      true if the insertion is successful, false if the new player has the same nickname as another player already inside the list

    • getTowerHolder

      public Player getTowerHolder(TowerColor towerColor)
      Gets the first player found who holds the towers. (TeamManager ensures only one for each team)
      Parameters:
      towerColor - The color of the towers (also means the team)
      Returns:
      The player who holds the towers

    • getTowerHolders

      public List<Player> getTowerHolders()

    • teamSize

      public int teamSize(TowerColor towerColor)
      Returns the current number of players in team (not the one it should have, just how many there are)
      Parameters:
      towerColor - The color of the tower (team) to count
      Returns:
      The number of players

    • getTeam

      public PlayerList getTeam(TowerColor towerColor)
      Returns the players of given team
      Parameters:
      towerColor - The team of the player
      Returns:
      a new PlayerList of players of a given team

    • getByNickname

      public Player getByNickname(String nickname)
      Finds a player in the list who has given nickname
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player to find
      Returns:
      The player found, or null if no player has given nickname
